edu.columbia.stat.wood.sequencememoizer
Interface SequenceMemoizer

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseSequenceMemoizer
public interface SequenceMemoizer

Discrete probabilistic sequence model based on hierarchical Pitman-Yor processes.

Author:
nicholasbartlett

Method Detail

limitMemory

void limitMemory(int maxNumberRestaurants)
Limits the number of restaurants the HPYP is allowed to instantiate. Memory is limited by creating a dependent HPYP through deletion. Deletion occurs uniformly at random over the leaf nodes.

Parameters:
maxNumberRestaurants - max allowable number of instantiated restaurants in the model

continueSequence

double continueSequence(int observation)
Incorporates the observation in the model with the assumption that this observation is the next in a continuing sequence.

Parameters:
observation - integer value of observation
Returns:
the log probability of the observation in the predictive distribution prior to the incorporation of the observation in the model

continueSequenceEncode

void continueSequenceEncode(int observation)
Incorporates the observation in the model with the assumption that this observation is the next in a continuing sequence.

Parameters:
observation - integer value of observation
range - container object for values of CDF(observation-1) and CDF(observation)

continueSequenceDecode

void continueSequenceDecode(double pointOnCdf)
Finds the observation on the predictive CDF such that CDF(observation) greater than pointOnCDF and CDF(observation - 1) less than or equal to pointOnCDF. The predictive CDF is calculated based on the assumption that the observation is the next in a continuing sequence. The observation is then incorporated into the model.

Parameters:
pointOnCdf - point on cdf, must be in [0.0,1.0)
rad - container object for observation type, CDF(observation-1), and CDF(observation)

continueSequence

double continueSequence(int[] observations)
Incorporates an array of observations into the model with the assumption that they are the next observations in a continuing sequence.

Parameters:
observations - observations to append
Returns:
the summed log probability of each observation prior to the incorporation of the observation in the model

generate

int[] generate(Sequence context,
               int numSamples)
Generates iid draws from the predictive distribution given the context.

Parameters:
context - sequence of integers specifying context
numSamples - number of iid draws to draw
Returns:
integer array of samples from context specific predictive distribution

generateSequence

int[] generateSequence(Sequence initialContext,
                       int sequenceLength)
Draws a single sequence by making independent draws from a sequence of predictive distributions indexed by the contexts that arise during sequential generation.

Parameters:
initialContext - context indexing initial predictive distribution
sequenceLength - number of draws made in sequence
Returns:
integer sequence sampled

predictiveDistribution

DiscreteDistribution predictiveDistribution(Sequence context)
Gets an iterator object to return the type, probability pairs which define the predictive PDF in the specified context.

Parameters:
context - context
Returns:
iterator object to return type, probability pairs of the predictive PDF

predictiveProbability

double predictiveProbability(Sequence context,
                             int token)
Gets the predictive probability of a token in a given context.

Parameters:
context - context
token - token to get predictive probability of
Returns:
predicitve probability of token in given context

sequenceProbability

double sequenceProbability(Sequence initialContext,
                           int[] sequence)
Scores a sequence given that it starts after a certain context.

Parameters:
initialContext - intial context
seqeunce - seqeunce of observations to score
Returns:
log predictive probability of observing seqeunce after context

sample

double sample(int numSweeps)
Do Gibbs sampling of the parameters of the model. Seating arrangements are sampled according to the exact conditional distributions while discount parameters are sampled using a Metropolis step with a normal jumping distribution. Independent flat priors are imposed on the individual discount parameters.

Parameters:
numSweeps - number of passes to make Gibbs sampling
Returns:
joint log likelihood of the data and model parameters

score

double score()
Get the joint log likelihood of the data and model parameters.

Returns:
joint log likelihood of the data and model parameters

getParameters

SequenceMemoizerParameters getParameters()
Get paramters.

Returns:
values of parameters of the model in its current state
